description: {"blocks":[{"key":"audea","text":"This protocol is about collecting mouse tissues for immunohistochemistry or biochemistry experiment. While it is mainly used for brain tissues, it also can be used for other visceral tissues. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6htpf","text":"Tissues are collected and post-fixed in   PFA at 4°C for about  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fthia","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"4","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aas6s","text":"Immobilize a mouse and cut through the skin and muscles in the lower abdomen exposing the liver using a sharp scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r16v","text":"Tissues for biochemical experiment such as gene expression analysis, protein assay or lipidomics are collected using snap-freezing in dry ice without perfusion, then stored at    o C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":178,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":176,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6914f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68uu0","text":"Grasp the heart firmly near the apex with a blunt forceps, then insert the butterfly needle gently into the left ventricle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an407","text":"Cut through the diaphragm, then down the right and left sides of the chest, through the ribs, until the heart is fully visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bo1i","text":"Using a small, sharp scissors, make a small cut in the right atrium to serve as a drain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2t403","text":"Flow 1x PBS (Quality Biological) containing 1 IU Heparin/mL (about  ) followed by   paraformaldehyde for fixation until evidence of stiffness of tissues is observed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hsjk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"4","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhgck","text":"The floating sections are collected with microtome combined with freezing unit. After getting 30~40 um thickness of floating sections, they can be stored in PBS-sodium azide (  ) solution for    maximum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":175,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":192,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3ffk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.05","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":4838400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcdk3","text":"For floating sections, tissues are transferred to 30% sucrose for cryoprotection, then kept at   for about   until tissues sink to the bottom of the vessel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4d0pt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65rvu","text":"For paraffin sections for histopathology evaluation, tissues are transferred to   ethanol after fixation then kept at    until usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aorhn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"70","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

title: Mouse tissue collection
